title: The moist boundary layer under a mid-latitude weather system

references.title: Boundary layer structure in relation to larger-scale flow: Some remarks on the JASIN observations. Phil Trans Roy Soc Lond A 308:445–449 Eady ET
Surface-flux regulation of the coupling between cumulus convection and baroclinic waves.

abstract:
Mid-latitude weather systems are key contributors to the transport of atmospheric\ud
water vapour, but less is known about the role of the boundary layer in\ud
this transport. We expand a conceptual model of dry boundary-layer structure under\ud
synoptic systems to include moist processes, using idealised simulations of cyclone\ud
waves to investigate the three-way interaction between the boundary layer, atmospheric\ud
moisture and large-scale dynamics. Forced by large-scale thermal advection,\ud
boundary-layer structures develop over large areas, analogous to the daytime convective\ud
boundary layer, the nocturnal stable boundary layer and transitional regimes\ud
between these extremes
